articles.title: Rsdoctor 1.0: An Analyzer for Rspack and Webpack
articles.description: A one-stop, intelligent build analyzer making it easier to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance. It‚Äôs part of the same family of tools as Rspack (a Rust-powered web bundler) but is fully webpack compatible. If you‚Äôve ever asked why your build times are too long, this is for you.
articles.author: ByteDance Inc.

articles.title: üìâ¬†How We Made Our Rich Text Editor Load Faster
articles.description: CKEditor is a long-standing, full featured GPL and commercially licensed rich text editor but its complexity can come with a performance cost. In this two part series (part two here), the CKEditor team digs into how they‚Äôve recently significantly boosted its performance.
articles.author: Szymon Cofalik (CKEditor)

articles.title: Next.js vs TanStack
articles.description: An incisive essay from a developer who‚Äôs had enough of the Next.js approach and has found solace in the approach offered by the increasingly capable TanStack collection of tools (as well as Vite).
articles.author: Kyle Gill

articles.title: How to Build a Snake AI Game with Docker and TensorFlow.js
articles.description: You‚Äôve probably heard about people ‚Äòvibe coding‚Äô games by letting LLMs do the coding work, but what if you want to build a game yourself that has neural network powered elements? TensorFlow.js offers one solution that you could just as easily adapt to non-gaming contexts.
articles.author: Manvar and Raina (Docker)

articles.title: The Great ESLint v9 Migration Adventure: A Developer's Survival¬†Guide
articles.description: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just say‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve seen things. I hit all the bumps, took all the wrong turns, and somehow made it to the other side‚Äîso you don‚Äôt have to.‚Äù
articles.author: Yacine Kharoubi

articles.title: React Trends in 2025
articles.description: Each year Robin does a post giving his opinion on what trends he sees arising over the next year. Last year, he put his money on Astro, RSCs, Vercel, and Biome ‚Äì this year he points at React Server Components, shadcn/ui, TanStack Start, React Router, and more.
articles.author: Robin Wieruch

articles.title: Build a Custom RAG AI Agent with TypeScript and Jupyter
articles.description: Deno, Ollama, and a few different AI models come together in this tutorial for storing document embeddings in a vector store and querying them for use in a basic agent.
articles.author: Kitson Kelly

articles.title: Introducing Motion for Vue
articles.description: Motion is a popular and powerful animation library most commonly associated with React, but now there‚Äôs a new Vue flavor and it‚Äôs feature complete, too.
articles.author: Matt Perry (Motion)

articles.title: Reveal.js 5.2: The HTML Presentation Framework
articles.description: Brings elegant presentations to anyone with a Web browser. v5.2 adds the ability to trigger ‚Äòlightboxes‚Äô where viewers can see images and videos in a way where they stand out more.
articles.author: Hakim El Hattab

articles.title: Konva: A JavaScript 2D Canvas Library
articles.description: The native API for Canvas elements is pretty good, but Konva is a popular abstraction that sits on top and provides a more structured way to work with shapes, styling, events, animations, and more (lots of demos with code). It also has extra integration libraries for Vue, Svelte and React.
articles.author: Konva

articles.title: Typist 8.0: Tiptap-Based Rich Text Editor Component
articles.description: Simple and opinionated. You can try several examples linked in the sidebar. Well suited for basic rich text situations like writing comments or messages and has a single-line mode. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Doist

articles.title: PeanoScript: TypeScript But It's a Theorem Prover
articles.description: An experimental proof assistant for Peano arithmetic based on TypeScript syntax.
articles.author: mjgrzymek

articles.description: This automatically updated runtime compatibility table lets you see how/if different server-side JavaScript runtimes support different APIs.
üí¨ If you'd like to hang out on Discord and chat with other Node.js developers, there's now an official Node.js Discord server.
The Node.js TSC has voted to stop distributing Corepack with future versions of Node. Corepack was originally introduced as a way to manage other package managers.
üõ†Ô∏è Make Bookmarklets is a handy tool for turning JavaScript into bookmarklet code that you can use directly in a browser bookmark.
Parcel v2.14.0 ‚Äì The zero-config bundler adds a new CLI to scaffold apps, first-class MDX support, and beta support for React Server Components.
Ionic 8.5 ‚Äì Cross-platform JS app development platform.
üìä Billboard.js 3.15.0 ‚Äì D3-powered JS chart library.
React Router 7.4

articles.title: A Deep Dive into the Inline Background Overlap Problem
articles.description: If you want to get a semi-transparent background behind some inline text with nice padding you‚Äôll likely face an overlap problem. Ana goes deep into exploring the solution along with some of the more complex variations of the issue that we could face.
articles.author: Ana Tudor

articles.title: Introducing command and commandfor
articles.description: Chrome 135 (and preview versions of Firefox and Safari) add support for two new HTML attributes, command and commandfor. They‚Äôre for adding declarative actions to HTML buttons without directly requiring JavaScript.
articles.author: Keith Cirkel

articles.title: üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è¬†Buying Browser Extensions for Fun and Profit
articles.description: An interesting look into the shadowy world of how browser extensions, with hundreds of thousands of users, can be easily bought ‚Äî potentially by malicious proprietors.
articles.author: John Tucker

articles.title: Styling Counters in CSS
articles.description: A guide to styling counters, going from the most basic ways to style lists directly in HTML to advanced customization techniques that are even capable of making things that aren‚Äôt lists look like lists.
articles.author: Juan Diego Rodr√≠guez

articles.title: Self Gap
articles.description: Some thinking on how best to control a custom gap between some flex or grid elements. As ever, Ahmad has code examples and solid demos to help explain the approaches considered.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: Breadcrumbs are 'Dead' in Web Design
articles.description: Once a clear staple in web design, the author argues that they‚Äôve now become somewhat obsolete in ‚Äútoday‚Äôs non-linear, context-driven web, where dynamic and personalized navigation systems take precedence‚Äù.
articles.author: Noah Davis

articles.title: Design Systems Need a Color Space
articles.description: ‚ÄúSoftware developers and designers have been able to ignore colour spaces for a long time, but it‚Äôs about to become required knowledge.‚Äù
articles.author: Marc Edwards

articles.title: Chilled Out Text Underlines
articles.description: Shares a nice treatment for styling underlines. Worth keeping in mind accessibility considerations though.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Styling an HTML Dialog Modal to Take the Full Height of the¬†Viewport
articles.description: Simon encountered an issue with an unwanted gap appearing when using the dialog element. Here‚Äôs how it was solved.
articles.author: Simon Willison

articles.title: Web Components vs. Framework Components:¬†What‚Äôs the¬†Difference?
articles.description: A comprehensive comparison between Web Components and framework components, discussing their definitions, strengths, weaknesses, and various performance considerations.
articles.author: Gabriel Shoyombo

articles.title: Use Cases for the Document Picture-in-Picture API
articles.description: A way to open a floating, always-on-top window (‚Äòpicture-in-picture‚Äô) that can display arbitrary HTML content. Chrome only, though.
articles.author: Jad Joubran

articles.title: But How to Get to That European Cloud?
articles.description: A thoughtful take on a pressing need for an increase in geographically diverse web infrastructure. Touches on broader political considerations that, naturally, not everyone may see the same way ‚Äî but, ‚Äòdon‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket‚Äô is generally good advice.
articles.author: Bert Hubert

articles.title: Tailwind Gradient Generator: Create CSS Gradients for Tailwind¬†Projects
articles.description: Select to preview any of the existing gradients in the gallery and customize the ‚Äòdirection‚Äô of the gradient. You can also preview the gradient on text (as seen above) or just as a regular background.
articles.author: oxbow ui

articles.title: Loadership: An Interactive Tool to Build and Customize Pure CSS Loading Animations
articles.description: Click any of the dozen or so prebuilt loaders (which are unique!) and you can customize them to your liking (color, speed, size, etc).
articles.author: Loadership

articles.title: Enhance: Enhance and Upscale Your Images Using AI
articles.description: Yet another single-purpose image editing tool from Addy Osmani, this one is a simple AI-powered image upscaler/enhancer that you can try out online here.
articles.author: Addy Osmani

articles.title: svg2pdf.js: SVG to PDF Conversion in the Browser
articles.description: There‚Äôs an online playground to give you a feel for what it can do.
articles.author: yWorks GmbH

articles.title: shiki-stream: Generate "Streaming" Syntax Highlighted Code
articles.description: Based on the popular Shiki syntax highlighter, this will reveal the selected code line by line (i.e. in a ‚Äústream‚Äù), which you can play with here.
articles.author: Anthony Fu

articles.title: Frontend Practice: A Practice Ground for Improving Frontend¬†Skills
articles.description: A collection of real sites each with a spec sheet that you can use to recreate the project to improve your skills.
articles.author: Kyle Shook
